Had to eliminate <30%: Trump base is about 35% and is solid: Trump will not go down below 30% even when he's impeeched. Also had to eliminate the other extreme of >60% approval. The Democrat base isn't going anywhere and it is about 40%. Had to put 0% for 50-60%: the never-Trumpers are still strong (evidence in the GA 6th district and SC special election), and Trump did not win the popular vote. Now the hard part: how much to put in the 30-40 bracket and how much in the 40-50 bracket. Starting with 100% in the 30-40 bracket (current position), what would nudge the poll up to 40-50 bracket? 1. The economy: even though it is improving at fast pace, it won't have enough time to change opinions. 2. His agenda: mostly pleasing his base and may convert some republicans/independents to his supporters column, but the two main items (repeal of Obamacare and tax reform) may not see the light before August 1 and even by then, won't sway opinions much. 3. His reaction toward external threat (such as 9/11 or invasion of Kuwait kind of magnitude): this may make unpopular president popular. But such event is rare and we won't have enough time to see it happen. 4. Statistical margin of error: +/-3% margin of error for Gallup polls. For example, if true approval rate were 38%, a poll may, by statistical fluke, read it as 41%, putting it in the 40% bracket.
